oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effect of clenbuterol administered during the expulsive stage of bovine parturition on uterine activity and the fetus
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Jonker, F. H.
van der Weijden, G. C.
Taverne, M. A. M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: intravenous injection
myometrial activity
fetal heart rate
fetal outcome
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The effect of an intravenous injection of 0-3 mg clenbuterol on myometrial activity, fetal heart rate and fetal outcome was studied in three groups of animals: six heifers in active labour at term, in which fetal oversize was diagnosed just before the drug was injected and whose calves were delivered by caesarean section within 50 minutes; four cows at the start of the explusive stage of parturition which had been induced with flumethasone on day 270 of gestation; and in four parturient cows which had had electrodes implanted on the myometrium at least one week before calving was induced with flumethasone on day 270.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1991; 43
